availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
JOHN BROUGH, Charles Anderson
GOVERNOR OF THE STATE OF OHIO.
To his Excellency, the Governor of the State of Kentucky.

It appears by the annexed papers, duly authenticated according to the Laws of our State, that John Philip Noel stands charged by affidavit with the crime of "Assault with Intent to commit Rape," committed in the county of Scioto, in said State, on the fourteenth day of October A.D. 1865. and it has been represented that the said John Philip Noel has fled from the Justice of this State, and has taken refuge within the State of Kentucky.

Now, Therefore, Pursuant to the provisions of the Constitution and Laws of the United States, in such case made and provided, I do hereby require that the said John Philip Noel be apprehended and delivered to Calvin I. Stevens who is hereby duly authorized to receive the said John Philip Noel and convey him to the State of Ohio, there to be dealt with according to law.

figure.ab:
THE GREAT SEAL OF THE STATE OF OHIO
1802

body.p: In Witness Whereof, I have hereunto affixed my name, and the Great Seal of the State of Ohio, at Columbus, this thirtieth day of October in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and sixty-five.

Charles Anderson
BY THE GOVERNOR:
Wm Henry Smith Secretary of State
